assessments.title: Libidinal Charge
assessments.goal_user: Identify which character(s) your energy naturally flows toward right now (motivation + aliveness).
assessments.answerRules: Choose from your 6 characters. Answer quickly; go with the first true pull.

questions.text: Right now, which character feels like the strongest pull on your energy?
questions.helper: Pick the one you’d instinctively ‘step into’ today.

questions.text: When life gets intense or high-stakes, which character shows up in you automatically?
questions.helper: Who takes the wheel when things get serious?

questions.text: Which character represents how you feel when you’re at your best—focused, alive, and in motion?
questions.helper: Not who you admire—who feels like ‘you at your best’.

questions.text: When you’re drained and need to recover, which character helps you come back to yourself?
questions.helper: Who restores you—emotionally or psychologically?

questions.text: If you had one free day with no obligations, which character’s life would you most want to live for that day?
questions.helper: This reveals your hidden ‘charge’ and desire.

questions.text: Which character best represents what you protect at all costs—truth, people, freedom, competence, love, meaning?
questions.helper: Pick the one whose values feel non‑negotiable.

assessments.title: Ego Position
assessments.goal_user: Identify your default conscious stance: how you decide, act, and hold identity under normal life.
assessments.answerRules: Choose the character that best matches your default mode, not your ideal self.

questions.text: On a normal day, which character is closest to how you naturally operate?
questions.helper: Your default pace, tone, and decision style.

questions.text: When you must make a decision quickly, which character’s decision style do you use most?
questions.helper: Instinctive—no overthinking.

questions.text: Which character best represents what you trust most: evidence, instinct, loyalty, strategy, or empathy?
questions.helper: Pick the one who matches your inner compass.

questions.text: In conflict, which character most resembles how you respond?
questions.helper: Do you confront, withdraw, negotiate, or outsmart?

questions.text: Which character best matches how you set boundaries when someone crosses a line?
questions.helper: How you say no, enforce, or detach.

assessments.title: Persona Formation
assessments.goal_user: Identify the face you present to the world to function: competence mask, social role, performance layer.
assessments.answerRules: Choose the character you ‘use’ in public or when you want to be respected.

questions.text: In public (work, strangers, formal settings), which character are you most likely to present as?
questions.helper: Your ‘default mask’ when you’re being observed.

questions.text: When you want respect or credibility, which character do you lean into?
questions.helper: Who do you become to be taken seriously?

questions.text: When you feel judged, which character’s style do you adopt to protect yourself?
questions.helper: Polish, humor, dominance, distance, charm, etc.

questions.text: Which character best represents what you hide from others: vulnerability, need, uncertainty, softness, or loneliness?
questions.helper: Pick the one whose ‘mask’ matches your defense.

questions.text: After a long day of ‘being on’, which character best represents how you feel inside?
questions.helper: This reveals persona fatigue.

assessments.title: Shadow Proximity
assessments.goal_user: Identify the rejected or dangerous parts: what you fear becoming, deny, or secretly use.
assessments.answerRules: Choose honestly; this is about what’s closest to you when you’re stressed or unguarded.

questions.text: When you’re stressed or cornered, which character’s darker side can show up in you?
questions.helper: Irritability, detachment, control, cynicism, numbness.

questions.text: Which character’s flaws feel uncomfortably relatable—even if you don’t want to admit it?
questions.helper: Not admiration—relatability.

questions.text: Which character best represents the trait you judge most harshly in others?
questions.helper: Often, what we judge is close to our shadow.

questions.text: Which character represents the ‘shadow strength’ you use when rules are irrational and you must stand alone?
questions.helper: Courage to defy fear-based consensus.

questions.text: Which character represents what you fear becoming if you lose meaning or connection?
questions.helper: This is your cautionary archetype.

assessments.title: Feeling Function (Anima/Animus) + Eros
assessments.goal_user: Identify what brings emotional aliveness and what you require for love/meaning (Eros).
assessments.answerRules: Answer based on what truly restores you and what you actually need, not what looks strong.

questions.text: Which character softens you and brings you back to warmth and humanity?
questions.helper: Who opens your heart without weakening your strength?

questions.text: Which character best represents the way you most want to feel loved—seen, chosen, safe, desired, understood?
questions.helper: This is about your emotional need, not your behavior.

questions.text: Which character best represents what blocks intimacy for you—skepticism, hyper-independence, control, or emotional distance?
questions.helper: Pick the closest blocker.

questions.text: When everything feels empty, which character helps you recover meaning?
questions.helper: Humor, care, beauty, romance, service, wonder.

questions.text: In close relationships, which character best matches your relational style—protective, avoidant, skeptical, playful, or devoted?
questions.helper: How you ‘do’ closeness, day-to-day.

assessments.title: Cost & Compensation
assessments.goal_user: Identify what each mode costs you over time, and what compensates to restore balance.
assessments.answerRules: Choose based on long-term effect, not short-term success.

questions.text: If you had to live as one of these characters for months, which one would slowly exhaust you—even if they are effective?
questions.helper: This reveals the hidden cost of a persona.

questions.text: Which character represents the mode you overuse when you’re trying to stay in control?
questions.helper: The one you rely on too often.

questions.text: Which character best represents what you sacrifice when you’re ‘performing’—sleep, joy, intimacy, play, softness, or time?
questions.helper: Pick the clearest sacrifice.

questions.text: Which character most restores you back to balance after heavy responsibility?
questions.helper: Your real compensator—warmth, humor, romance, stillness, play.

questions.text: Which character represents the risk of becoming ‘successful but hollow’?
questions.helper: Image without inner truth.

questions.text: Which character represents the kind of compensation you avoid, even though you need it (rest, intimacy, play, asking for help)?
questions.helper: The missing medicine.

assessments.title: Individuation Direction
assessments.goal_user: Identify your next integrative direction: which qualities to bring online to move toward the Self.
assessments.answerRules: You may select up to 3 characters if the direction is a synthesis.

questions.text: To become more whole, which character holds the quality you need to develop next?
questions.helper: Not your default—your missing piece.

questions.text: If your future self is a synthesis, pick up to 3 characters that best represent that direction.
questions.helper: Choose the combination that feels like your ‘next chapter’.

questions.text: Which character represents the pattern you must stop living inside (even if it works)?
questions.helper: The one you’re outgrowing.

questions.text: Which character represents what you must return to regularly to stay aligned (warmth, love, play, meaning)?
questions.helper: Your alignment anchor.

questions.text: In a real-life turning point (new job, major relationship choice, family crisis), which character should lead you so you stay aligned with your Self?
questions.helper: The ‘leader’ at the crossroads.
